#include <string.h>
#include <assert.h>
#include "cvmx.h"
#include "cvmx-key.h"
#include "openssl/aes.h"

 RFC 4434 implementation.

 Multicall AES XCBC PRF128 Implementation.

Function Documentation

int cvm_crypto_aes_xcbc_prf128 (  uint64_t *    orgkey,
uint32_t    bits,
uint64_t *    data,
uint32_t    dlen,
uint64_t *    mac
) 
 

RFC 4434 implementation.

Parameters:
orgkey  pointer to key
orgkeylength  key length in bytes, 1<=orgkeylength<=32
data  pointer to data,for which prf128 should be calculated
dlen  number of valid bytes pointed by data(need not be 8 multiple)
mac  result pointer where mac should be written
Returns:
0 on success, -1 on failure

int cvm_crypto_aes_xcbc_prf128_final (  AES_KEY *    key,
AES_XCBC_MAC_CTX *    ctx,
uint64_t *    mac
) 
 

Multicall final function, should be called at last.

Parameters:
key  AES_KEY that was passed to cvm_crypto_aes_xcbc_prf128_init function,becomes invalid after this call.
mac  16 byte preallocated location,where mac will be written after the call
Returns:
0 on success, -1 on failure

int cvm_crypto_aes_xcbc_prf128_init (  uint8_t *    orgkey,
uint32_t    bits,
AES_KEY *    key,
AES_XCBC_MAC_CTX *    ctx
) 
 

Multicall AES XCBC PRF128 Implementation.

Parameters:
orgkey  key byte array pointer
bits  No of bits in the key (only 128 is supported right now)
key  AES_KEY to be initialized, opaque to the user, becomes invalid after cvm_crypto_aes_xcbc_prf128_final call
state  pointer to preallocated 128 byte array,opaque quantity for user.
Returns:
0 on success, -1 on failure

int cvm_crypto_aes_xcbc_prf128_update (  AES_KEY *    key,
uint8_t *    data,
uint32_t    dlen,
AES_XCBC_MAC_CTX *    ctx
) 
 

Multicall update function.

Parameters:
key  AES_KEY that was passed to cvm_crypto_aes_xcbc_prf128_init function
data  pointer to data
dlen  should be multiple of 16 except last call where it can be 0-16
state  PreAllocated state that was passed to cvm_crypto_aes_xcbc_mac_init function.
Returns:
0 on success, -1 on failure
